page.title: 20THE SPINNEY IN BOXFORD
page.content:
The Spinney is a meadow and lots of trees where the Guides, Brownies, Cubs and Scouts from Boxford camp. Other Scouts, Cubs, Guides and Brownies can use it as well. Public people can use it too.
In four years the Guides, Brownies, Cubs and Scouts have raised 14,000 pounds towards building a hut for meetings, they need 8,000 pounds more. They have grants of 4,500 pounds from the Silver Jubilee Trust. They raised the money by having jumble sales and doing odd jobs for people. They are hoping to have it finished by January 1986.
